#: Auto-detect connected display hardware and load appropiate X11 setup
using xrandr
(https://github.com/phillipberndt/autorandr)
name: autorandr

#: i3 is a tiling window manager for X11.
This is a package group which installs the i3-gaps fork
(https://www.archlinux.org/groups/x86_64/i3/)
name: i3

#: Background browser and setter for X windows
(https://www.archlinux.org/packages/extra/x86_64/nitrogen/)
name: nitrogen

#: X compositor that may fix tearing issues
A fork from the original Compton because it seems to have become
unmaintained
(https://github.com/yshui/picom)
name: picom

#: A small program for hiding the mouse cursor
(https://github.com/Airblader/unclutter-xfixes)
name: unclutter

#: Generic input driver for the X.Org server based on libinput
Used in part to support customizing touchpads on physical laptops
name: xf86-input-libinput

#: Xorg X server
name: xorg-server

#: X.Org initialisation program (i.e. startx)
name: xorg-xinit

#: Small commandline tool to configure devices
Used in part to support customizing touchpads on physical laptops
name: xorg-xinput

#: User preference utility for X
name: xorg-xset
